choices.name: Get started with research for your Florida ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Florida ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Florida research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Florida research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Florida Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Get an overview of Florida research in this video.

    ☆ FS—Florida Overview—3:17

  3. Follow this research study for Florida ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Florida Research, 1880-Present

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Florida research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Florida Resources
    ☆ AC—Florida State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Florida Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Florida Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about colonial records in Florida.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Florida

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Florida in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Florida
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Minorities

    2. To learn more about African American records, study this article.

      ☆ AG—Florida African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Florida.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Florida in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Florida


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about colonial records in Florida.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Records of Florida
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Florida in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Florida
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Minorities

  2. To learn more about African American records, study this article.

    ☆ AG—Florida African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Florida.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Florida in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Florida

1. Explore Florida historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Florida History

  2. Explore Florida history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Florida

  3. Learn about Florida history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Florida History

choices.name: Learn about Florida archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Florida archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Florida State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Explore genealogy resources on the Florida Memory site.
  3. Explore the Florida Dept of Archives site.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Florida.
  5. Explore the Florida Memory Project.
  6. Explore the Florida Division of Library and Information Services site.
  7. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Florida genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  8. Search for ☆free online books on Florida research on the FamilySearch site.
  9. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Florida ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Florida city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Florida city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Florida city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Florida ☆historical directories by county.

QUIKLinks

hidden.content:
• Find online resources for vital records.
  • Learn the history of vital records in the state of Florida.
  • Learn about alternates for vital records in Florida.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for vital records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Florida vital records in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Vital Records
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Florida Vital Records
  2. Explore links for vital records on the Florida Public Health site.
  3. Search for online Florida ☆vital records and find addresses for state offices to write to for records.
  4. Explore Florida birth, marriage, and death records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Florida vital records on the ☆Linkpendium site and the Genealogy Branches site.

hidden.content: • Find birth and adoption records for Florida ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for birth and adoption records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn how to find Florida birth records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Florida Birth Records

  2. Get help with adoption topics on the Florida Adoptees / Birth Parents Facebook page.
  3. Explore additional links for Florida birth records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Explore Florida obituaries and death records.

hidden.content:
• Find obituaries for Florida ancestors.
  • Find death records and death indexes for Florida ancestors.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for obituary and death records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ObituariesHelp site for Florida obituaries.
  2. Explore The Ancestor Hunt for obituaries.
  3. Search for obituaries by county on the Newspaperobituaries.net site.
  4. Find additional resources for Florida obituaries on the ☆Linkpendium site.
Florida Death Records
  1. Learn how to find Florida death records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: How to Find Death Birth Records

  2. Explore the Ancestors at Rest site for Florida death records.
  3. Explore Florida death records, indexes, and obituaries.
  4. Explore additional links for Florida death records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

QUIKLinks

    ☆ FS—Florida Census

  2. Explore the MyFreeCensus site for Florida state and county census records.
  3. Explore additional links for Florida census records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

  5. Learn about Florida voting registers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Florida Voting Registers

hidden.content: • Find cemetery records for Florida ancestors from a number of sources.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for cemetery records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.

content.text:
1. Explore Florida cemetery records in this article.

    ☆ FS—Florida Cemetery Records
  2. Browse the ☆Interment.net site for Florida cemetery records.
  3. Search for Florida cemetery records online.
  4. Explore Florida cemetery records on the ☆AccessGenealogy site.
  5. Explore additional links for Florida cemetery records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  6. Explore the ☆Tombstone Transcription Project on the U.S. GenWeb site.
  7. Explore ☆African American cemetery records in Florida.
  8. Search the ☆Find A Grave site for cemetery records.
  9. Search the ☆BillionGraves site for cemetery records.
  10. See additional cemetery resources on the Florida ☆Linkpendium site.

choices.name: Learn about Florida maps and gazetteers.

hidden.content:
• Learn about the history of Florida maps.
  • Find out how Florida gazetteers can help you in your research.

content.text:
1. Learn about Florida maps in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Maps
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Florida Maps

  2. Learn about Florida gazetteers in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Gazetteers

  3. Access interactive maps and atlases of Florida on the ☆MapsofUS site.
  4. Find Florida towns and communities on the RoadsideThoughts site.

hidden.content:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for maps and gazetteers. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Explore the ☆David Rumsey collection of Florida maps.
  2. Explore the ☆Perry-Castaneda site for maps of Florida.
  3. Explore historical Florida maps on the Historic Map Works site.
  4. Explore the ☆Old Maps Online site for Florida maps.
  5. Explore the ☆Old Maps of Florida on the Wikipedia site.

hidden.content:
• Discover the history of Florida newspapers.
  • Learn more about how to use Florida periodical and manuscripts.

content.text:
1. Learn about Florida newspapers in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Newspapers
    ☆ AC—Wiki: Florida Periodicals, Newspapers, and Manuscripts

  2. Learn about researching historical Florida newspapers in this tutorial from The Ancestor Hunt.

    ☆ Research Free Historical Florida Newspapers—7:59

hidden.content:
• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Florida online newspaper sites.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for newspaper records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Search for ☆Florida historical newspapers in the Library of Congress collection.
  2. Find links to Florida newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Florida Online Historical Newspapers site.
  4. Explore Florida newspaper resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  5. See additional Florida newspaper resources on the Linkpendium site.
  6. Explore additional links for Florida newspapers and obituaries records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Florida County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Florida.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Florida Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Florida Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Florida Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Florida Genealogy - Just Ask! on Facebook.
  4. Visit the Florida State Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  5. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  6. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Florida.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Florida research.
  2. Explore the Florida research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Florida research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Florida in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Florida Societies

  2. Explore the Florida State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Central Florida Genealogical Society, Inc site.
  4. Explore the Genealogical Society of Greater Miami site.
  5. Explore the Jacksonville Genealogical Society site.
  6. Explore Florida genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  7. Get help at a family history center in Florida.

Regional/Local Societies
